To go to war or not to go to war. It‚Äôs a difficult decision. He made the wrong one. That‚Äôs all. If he knew he‚Äôd die, he wouldn‚Äôt have gone

I don't think the first two guys really got the point. Eugene wanted to be there for his sister so she could thrive even though they had bad circumstances. He thought that the only way that he could do this was joining the military. However, this proved to be a really dumb decision as he was weak and got killed.
I'm not even sure how profitable the military is compared to getting a job at a bakery or something. If it is indeed a good way to make money, then Shin must be rolling in dough

Yeah, Eugene wanted his sister to go to school, and ultimately they wanted to escape from poverty, but he chose the wrong job as he is not fit for it. When he said that his superior told him that it's normal when 15 people died in that day, he probably subconsciously knew that he was going to die, and yeah he was stupid for insisting himself to protect the country for her sister as he could have just took a different job while taking care of his sister.

The reason he chose the military is because he knew the war is very difficult currently, they are losing against the legion. As long as the legion don't shut down for good they can't live a peaceful life. Plus in military he also gets meal to eat, so that's a plus as well. Think about it for a second before calling the man stupid.
